dnd5e-spellpoints.actorNoSPV3: {ActorName} doesn't have a 'Class Feature' Item with the custom label {SpellPoints}.
dnd5e-spellpoints.alreadySpItemOwned: There is already a spell point item on this character. Please remove the duplicate.
dnd5e-spellpoints.AMInstructions: This module allows you to customize spell point costs and enables other options below, not used with the default rules. You can find an alternate system available for free on the
dnd5e-spellpoints.AMInstructions2: options below are part of the rules explained in that module.
dnd5e-spellpoints.autoNote: Enable this setting if you want the module to do the math for you every time a player character advances in a class level or gains a new class.
dnd5e-spellpoints.castedLife: {ActorName} cast a spell using their own life, losing {hpMaxLost} Maximum Hit Points.
dnd5e-spellpoints.castedLifeDead: {ActorName} cast a spell using their life. Their Hit Points Maximum reached 0, and they died permanently!
dnd5e-spellpoints.casterProgNotes: By standard rules half casters will get their caster level halved when calculating spellpoints and will be divided by three for third casters, you can change that here.
dnd5e-spellpoints.chatMessagePrivateLabe: Make Spell Points usage messages private.
dnd5e-spellpoints.chatMessagePrivateNote: Enabling this setting will make the chat messages about how many Spell Points have been used visible only to the GM and the current player; other players will not see the message.
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableForNpcLabel: Enable Spell Points for NPC Actors.
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableModuleHint: Enables or disables spell points for casting spells. This will override the slot cost for player tokens.
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableVariantLabel: Use HP as Spell Points (Gritty Variant).
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableVariantNote: Enabling this setting allows Player Characters to continue casting spells once they run out of spell points, using their own life at increased cost (see Advanced Magic System).
dnd5e-spellpoints.form: Open the Spell Points System Configuration.
dnd5e-spellpoints.form-hint: Here you can configure module behavior, spell point cost, and more.
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaBaseNote: A single formula used to determine how many spell points a character has and will be recalculated each character level.
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaNote: What formula should this module use to calculate the maximum PC spell points and spell cost (default: DMG).
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaNote2: Choosing Advanced Magic (homebrew) will calculate spell points according to the free homebrew module 'Advanced Magic - Spell Points System 5e', available for free on the
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaSlotNote: The slot formula multiplies the total Spell Point costs of each slot that the character would have.
dnd5e-spellpoints.leveledNotes: The spell points a character would have at any given caster level. You can use formulas, such as: '5+@attributes.spellmod', if you want to add the spellcasting modifier to the fixed number of spell points.
dnd5e-spellpoints.itemUsage: Add this item to the character sheet to give them the ability to use Spell Points / Mana / Spell Points.
dnd5e-spellpoints.notEnoughSp: {ActorName} doesn't have enough {SpellPoints} to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.oldResourceFound: Found an old Spell Point resource.
dnd5e-spellpoints.oldResourceFoundDesc: An old resource has been found on this character for use with Spell Points. Would you like to import the resource data and remove it?
dnd5e-spellpoints.pleaseCreate: Please create a resource named '{SpellPoints}' to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.pleaseCreateV3: Please create a 'Class Feature' Item with the custom label: '{SpellPoints}' to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.settingResetConfirmTex: Every configuration will be reset to default. Are you sure you want to do this?
dnd5e-spellpoints.resourceNote: This is the name of the resource on the Player Character Sheet that represents the spell points (default: Spell Points).
dnd5e-spellpoints.spellPointsCostsNote: You don't need to change the spell point costs if you are using the default spell point rules in DMG (page 288). You can use formulas to determine the cost.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spLifeCostNote: How many Hit Points Maximum a character will lose casting a spell with their own life. This is a multiplier. For example, if set to 2, a character casting a spell with a cost of 2 spell points will lose 4 HP maximum. (default: 2).
dnd5e-spellpoints.useLeveledProgressionN: If you need calculation on NPC remeber that this setting won't work for casters NPCs since they have no class nor caster level in Foundry. If you want some kind of calculation for caster NPCs, use the single formula (you can do that just for NPCs by overriding this setting on their specific Spell Points item).
dnd5e-spellpoints.youNotEnough: You don't have enough '{SpellPoints}' to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spGmOnlyNote: Unchecking this allows every player to override the Spell Points item from their character sheet.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spGmOnly: Only the GM is allowed to edit the Spell Point Item.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spOverrideNote1: Using the item, it is possible to have different Spell Points Settings for every character. You can override the spell point configuration by editing the item. If you do it directly in the character sheet, those settings will apply only to that character.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spOverrideNote2: You could also create multiple different copies of the spell points Item, give those different names, like 'Warlock's ManaSystem', 'Homebrew Psi Points', or anything you want, and reuse those on multiple characters or save them in your compendium and share with the community.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spellPointsFound: Found '{SpellPoints}' on {Actor} character sheet! Your Maximum {SpellPoints} have been updated.
dnd5e-spellpoints.updateSpellPointMaxToo: Reset the max value according to your configuration.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spResourceBarActive: View the spellpoints resource bar on the character sheet
